OOC: Between the little I've read about it, the little
you've told me, and the little I actually bothered to
read in this post I can tell this is Battletech.  What
does that have to do with NBW?

--- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@...> wrote:
> Hull of the warship Bloody Fang
> Strana Mechty High Orbit
> Clan Space
> 3063
> 
> "Because we will in a perpetual state of war, combat
> is always the 
> last judge. Ghost Bear warrior Ragnar will fight for
> the proposal, and 
> Wolf warrior Vladimir Ward will fight against it."
> 
> "Seyla" Vlad whispered the word, knowing that both
> his opponent and 
> the Loremaster and pronounced it too.
> 
> Ragnar. He had thought the freebirth to be stuck in
> the Inner Sphere 
> with the Warden Clan Wolf in exile, but the Ghost
> Bear had taken him 
> as a bondsman and made him a Star Colonel in their
> Alpha Galaxy. He 
> had been the prot�g� of his nemesis, Phelan Kell,
> the much hated 
> freeborn Khan of those renegade Wolves, which made
> Vlad even more 
> eager to slay him...
> 
> Katya Kerensky of Clan Wolf rode in her new
> Solitaire battlemech. She 
> had been selected to be the loremaster for this
> trial and had chosen 
> to test the new light mech. Though it was a complete
> change from her 
> Timber Wolf omnimech (the same her Khan had in this
> battle) she was 
> used to, both because of its 50 tons less, its
> reduced armament and 
> its awesome speed, she liked the mech so far.
> She evaluated the warriors. Vlad had a powerful
> Timber Wolf. If any 
> mech could match speed, armor and firepower, this
> one could. Bristling 
> with two box of missiles on each shoulder and lasers
> on each arm,the 
> birdlike mech was a threat. Still, Ragnar was better
> armed. He manned 
> a Dire Wolf, a heavier version of the Timber Wolf,
> and probably the 
> most feared machine in known space. At 100 tons, the
> juggernaut was 
> armed to the teeth, with a gauss rifle, a heavy
> autocannon and lots of 
> lasers. It was slower, though, and thus, would have
> more trouble 
> tracking the Khan. Only the pilots could tell the
> odds...
> 
> Katya: Skill, warriors. The trial begins now!
> 
> Ragnar sent his metal titan walking forward, sending
> a volley of 
> lasers at his opponent. He was thanked by laserfire
> and a swarm of 
> missiles. He knew Vlad would try to hurt him by any
> means possible, 
> both because of what he stood for and because he had
> once been the 
> Prince of an Inner Sphere realm, captured by Clan
> Wolf. He knew that 
> rushing would only make him lose his target, so he
> preferred to close 
> into range and hurt his foe with what he could.
> 
> Yet, as the fighting went on, no one noticed the
> energy wave coming 
> in. It had taken millions of years to reach this far
> in the universe, 
> having originated from the explosion of an empty
> moon.
> 
> The wave hit first the mechs, then the ship, setting
> off the 
> Kearny-Fuchida drives that enabled hyperspace jumps.
> Within seconds, 
> the massive destruction machines vanished from the
> skies of Strana 
> Mechty, three Clan officers along with it.
> 
> 
>
